testcase.brief: 2 Portal, 1 MP boot up(full mesh), Portal up/down check route failover. Route converge.
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-configure three APs in the same subnet and same hive -Boot portal 1 first and then boot portal2 -MP1 is mesh point
Test Procedure:
1. Show route, check route table in Portal1,Portal2(default route ,node route) 2. Show route, check route table in MP1. 3. If MP1 selecting Portal1 as Portal, change wifi-link cost of MP1 to Portal1,check route table again, 4. Plug out cable of Portal1, Show amrp ethlink, check route table. 5. Plug in cable of portal1, Show amrp ethlink , check route table 6. Shut down the MP1,check route table 7. Client associate MP1 Client ping wired pc Client ping ap1,ap2,ap3 8. 8. Client associate Portal1 Client ping wired pc Client ping ap1,ap2,ap3 9. Client associate Portal2 Client ping wired pc Client ping ap1,ap2,ap3

step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "ssid ${conn1.ssid}" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn1.ssid}" -v "interface wifi1 radio channel 40" -v "interface eth0 shutdown" -v "save config"

-v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface eth0 mode backhaul" -v "interface eth0 mac-learning enable" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "no interface mgt0 ip" -v "interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "interface wifi0 mode dual" -v "interface wifi0 radio channel 6" -v "ssid ${conn1.ssid}" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn1.ssid}" -v "interface eth0 shutdown" -v "save config"

step.desc: -configure AP2 as Portal1, make sure it will be select as DA
step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "ssid ${conn2.ssid}" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn2.ssid}" -v "interface wifi1 radio channel 40" -v "amrp interface eth0 priority 100" -v "save config"

step.desc: -configure AP2 as Portal1, make sure it will be select as DA
step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface eth0 mode backhaul" -v "interface eth0 mac-learning enable" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "no interface mgt0 ip" -v "interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "interface wifi0 mode dual" -v "interface wifi0 radio channel 6" -v "ssid ${conn2.ssid}" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn2.ssid}" -v "amrp interface eth0 priority 100" -v "save config"

step.desc: -configure AP3 as Portal2, make sure it as BDA
step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "ssid ${conn3.ssid}" -v "amrp interface eth0 priority 50" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn3.ssid}" -v "interface wifi1 radio channel 40" -v "save config"

step.desc: -configure AP3 as Portal2, make sure it as BDA
step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface eth0 mode backhaul" -v "interface eth0 mac-learning enable" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "no interface mgt0 ip" -v "interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "interface wifi0 mode dual" -v "interface wifi0 radio channel 6" -v "ssid ${conn3.ssid}" -v "amrp interface eth0 priority 50" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${conn3.ssid}" -v "save config"

step.desc: Make sure MP1 will select portal1 as its portal
step.console: -v "amrp neighbor ${portal2.mgt0.mac} metric min 1000 max 1200" -v "amrp neighbor ${portal1.mgt0.mac} metric min 100 max 200" -v "save config"

step.desc: -Boot portal 1 first and then boot portal2
1. Show route, check route table in Portal1
1. Show route, check route table in Portal1
Show route, check route table in Portal2
Show route, check route table in Portal2
2. Show route, check route table in MP1.
2. Show route, check route table in MP1.
3. MP1 selecting Portal1 as Portal, change wifi-link cost of MP1 for Portal1,check route table again,
step.console: -v "amrp neighbor ${portal1.wifi1.mac} metric min 1000 max 1200" -v "amrp neighbor ${portal2.wifi1.mac} metric min 100 max 200"

step.desc: 3. MP1 will selecting Portal2 as Portal
3. MP1 will selecting Portal2 as Portal
4. Plug out cable of Portal1, Show amrp ethlink, check route table.
check if the mp1 default route change
4. Default route will be changed to wifi1.1,.Portal1 selecting Portal2 as portal
4. Default route will be changed to wifi1.1,.Portal1 selecting Portal2 as portal
5. Plug in cable of portal1, Show amrp ethlink , check route table
5. Default route will be eth0 again, should not effect other route entry
Show route, check route table in Portal2
Show route, check route table in Portal2
2. Show route, check route table in MP1.
2. Show route, check route table in MP1.
6. Amrp should delete the route of MP1 in portal’s route table.
6. Amrp should delete the route of MP1 in portal’s route table.
6. Amrp should delete the route of MP1 in portal’s route table.
6. Amrp should delete the route of MP1 in portal’s route table.
6. no shutdown the MP1,check route table
6. no shutdown the MP1,check route table
Amrp should not add the route of MP1 in portal1 route table.
Amrp should not add the route of MP1 in portal1 route table.
Amrp should add the route of MP1 in portal2 route table.
Amrp should add the route of MP1 in portal2 route table.

step.console: -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "_ff protocol 1" -v "clear log all"
-v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "_ff protocol 1" -v "clear log all"
-v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "_ff protocol 1" -v "clear log all"
